content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, one third times x cubed, minus 3 times x squared, minus 16 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> both decreasing and concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 3 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 8 comma infinity, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> only

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
